{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3469474,"name":"Rick Sellens","username":"sellensr","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sellensr/{size}/184290_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-04T21:42:21.753Z","cooked":"

5.3 Reef says the pipes are 1-1/4 " Schedule 40 Steel. 1-1/4" nominal pipe size is actually 1.66" OD and that matches the CAD files released.

5.4.1 Cage says the pipes are steel 1-3/8" Schedule 40, a nominal size that doesn’t show up in my charts. The CAD files show an OD of 1.315", that matches 1" nominal pipe size. Can anybody confirm that the pipes for the cages are 1" Schedule 40?

sellensr:

Can anybody confirm that the pipes for the cages are 1" Schedule 40?

Only Q&A could confirm it. And maybe not - I seem to recall they only wanted to answer game questions in prior years.

Fixed in TU1

Section 5.4.1 CAGE
CAGES are 2 ft. tall and 7⅜ in. wide (outside dimension) (~61 cm tall and ~19 cm wide) rectangular structures.
Each CAGE is a welded structure made of 4 steel 1-⅜ in. 1 in. Schedule 40 pipes, a bottom plate, a top plate,
and an eyebolt with fastening hardware
